speaker: High Aqueduct
lines: Stone ribs stride the valley; water once walked here like a king.
Below, streets knot around courtyards like prayers around altars.
Tiles glitter in sun-patches where roofs gave up dignity for honesty.
A brass pipe sings in the wind, a thin music for engineers and ghosts.
The view rearranges your sense of important.
A ladder drops to a balcony where ivy keeps a library from leaving.
A cracked conduit leads toward a hall that hums like a clock.
Your hands itch to take the ladder. Your heart wants to hear the hum.
The city wonders which you areâ€”reader or repairman.

choices.text: Follow the hum to the Clockwork Hall.
